source__citation: Bryant, V.M., and R.G. Holloway. 1985. “A late-Quaternary paleoenvironmental record of Texas: an overview of the pollen evidence.” In Pollen Records of Late-Quaternary North American Sediments, edited by Vaughn M. Bryant and Holloway, Richard G., 39–70. Dallas, TX: American Association of Stratigraphic Palynologists.
source__title: A Late-Quaternary Paleoenvironmental Record of Texas
editorialNote: Chapter from an edited volume; WorldCat URL is for the volume as a whole. The authors state on p. 41 that they will use "the time periods originally proposed by Hafsten (1961)", citing U. Hafsten, 1961, "Pleistocene development of vegetation and climate in the southern high plains as evidence by pollen analysis", in: Wendorf., F. (ed.), Paleoecology of the Llano Estacado, Fort Burgwin Research Center, I, Museum of New Mexico Press, Santa Fe, New Mexico: 59-91.

periods__|__editorialNote: "Present" understood in traditional B.P. dating context as 1950.
